item.title: Workflow Description Language (WDL) in Emacs
item.description: I recently started working with WDL files. The Broad Institute recommends using Sublime and the syntax highlighter that they provide. They also provide a syntax highlighter for Vim. I started by looking for a solution in Emacs, my go-to editor. Luckily there was already a WDL mode available that I just slightly improved. I also made a polymode to complement it. Both are available through MELPA as wdl-mode and poly-mode.
